se.walkercrou.ghp.ghp

Class GitHubPages

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.walkercrou.ghp.ghp.GitHubPages

  • public class GitHubPages
extends Object
    Interacts with the "GitHub Pages" feature on GitHub.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String APIDOCS
      The default directory to copy to repository.
      static String DEFAULT_BRANCH
      The default branch to push content to, 'gh-pages' is the only branch that will update your "GitHub page" however leaving this configurable leaves room to re-purpose this library.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GitHubPages(org.apache.maven.plugin.Mojo mojo, File workingDir, File contentDir, String uri)
      Creates a new GitHubPages object and clones the specified repository.
      GitHubPages(org.apache.maven.plugin.Mojo mojo, File workingDir, File contentDir, String uri, String branch)
      Creates a new GitHubPages object and clones the specified repository.
      GitHubPages(org.apache.maven.plugin.Mojo mojo, File workingDir, String uri)
      Creates a new GitHubPages object and clones the specified repository.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addContent()
      Copies the contents from APIDOCS to the working directory.
      void addContent(File dir)
      Copies the contents from the specified directory to the working directory.
      void resetContent()
      Removes all files from the git repository and the working directory.
      void update(String commitMessage)
      Adds all of the files in the directory to the git repository, commits the changes, and pushes to the remote.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_BRANCH

        public static final String DEFAULT_BRANCH
        The default branch to push content to, 'gh-pages' is the only branch that will update your "GitHub page" however leaving this configurable leaves room to re-purpose this library.

        Constant Field Values

        The default directory to copy to repository.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GitHubPages

        public GitHubPages(org.apache.maven.plugin.Mojo mojo,
                   File workingDir,
                   File contentDir,
                   String uri,
                   String branch)
            throws org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException,
                   org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoFailureException
        Creates a new GitHubPages object and clones the specified repository.
        Parameters:
        mojo - plugin execution
        workingDir - to clone repo to
        contentDir - directory within workingDir that content should be copied to
        uri - to clone repo from
        branch - of repo to clone
        Throws:
        org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException - if the workingDir cannot be created or the repo cannot be cloned
        org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoFailureException - if content directory is not a subdirectory of working directory

      • GitHubPages

        public GitHubPages(org.apache.maven.plugin.Mojo mojo,
                   File workingDir,
                   File contentDir,
                   String uri)
            throws org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException,
                   org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoFailureException
        Creates a new GitHubPages object and clones the specified repository. The constructor uses DEFAULT_BRANCH as the branch parameter.
        Parameters:
        mojo - plugin execution
        workingDir - to clone repo to
        contentDir - directory within workingDir that content should be copied to
        uri - to clone repo from
        Throws:
        org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException - if the workingDir cannot be created or the repo cannot be cloned
        org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoFailureException - if content directory is not a subdirectory of working directory

        public void resetContent()
                  throws org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
        Removes all files from the git repository and the working directory.
        Throws:
        org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException - if the files cannot be removed from git or the directory

      • addContent

                throws org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
        Copies the contents from the specified directory to the working directory.
        Parameters:
        dir - to copy content from
        Throws:
        org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException - if the content directory is not found or the files cannot be copied

      • addContent

        public void addContent()
                throws org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
        Copies the contents from APIDOCS to the working directory.
        Throws:
        org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException - if the content directory is not found or the files cannot be copied

      • update

        public void update(String commitMessage)
            throws org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
        Adds all of the files in the directory to the git repository, commits the changes, and pushes to the remote.
        Parameters:
        commitMessage - to use in commit
        Throws:
        org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException - if the files cannot be added, commited, or pushed
